question: 1 (a)
statement_html: Suppose \(\displaystyle m > 1\) is a positive integer and \(\displaystyle (a,m) = 1\). State the definition of the inverse \(\overline a\) of \(\displaystyle a\) modulo \(\displaystyle m\).
statement_latex:
Suppose $\displaystyle m > 1$ is a positive integer and
$\displaystyle (a,m) = 1$. State the definition of the inverse
$\overline a$ of $\displaystyle a$ modulo $\displaystyle m$.
statement_raw: Suppose <math> \displaystyle m > 1 </math> is a positive integer and <math>\displaystyle (a,m) = 1</math>. State the definition of the inverse <math>\overline a</math> of <math>\displaystyle a</math> modulo <math>\displaystyle m</math>.
